awd_titl_txt: Identification and Active Control of Structures Under       Earthquake Loadings
awd_abstract_narration: This project consists of two research parts:                                    (1) verification and utilization as a                                           proposed controller of a new system                                             identification (SI) technique, and (2) study                                    of two active control schemes, i.e., the                                        modified Luenberger pole placement and neural                                   control algorithms, for the active control of                                   structures against earthquakes.  The main                                       objective is to investigate the feasibility                                     and application of these two control schemes                                    in protection of civil engineering structures                                   under seismic conditions.                                                                                                                                       A 10-story apartment building in San Jose,                                      California whose 13 seismic instruments have                                    recorded many earthquake response data will                                     be analyzed to validate a system                                                identification technique which is capable of                                    identifying the structural dynamic model from                                   the measured response records and without                                       knowing the seismic input.  This SI technique                                   will be incorporated into the formulation of                                    two control schemes, whose feasibility and                                      effectiveness will then be studied.                                                                                                                             This project contains an important component                                    of Research Opportunity Awards (ROA) and                                        provides collaborative support for a faculty                                    researcher from a historically minority                                         institution.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
